website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for cutting through rope and fishing line and other outdoor-related tasks. Easy and dependable one-handed operation.
pros: Four-way pocket clip allows for multiple carry and draw options
Oversize thumb hole in blade for easier one-handed opening
Blade arrives in extremely sharp condition
Utility use for cutting rope and other outdoor tasks
cons: Blade is coated, not bare stainless steel

customer_reviews.title: FAKE😒.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not to sure if this is a fake or not. Misspelled words in the letter that you receive and the action seemed a little different. Not taking the chance.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Almost magical.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. Super sharp out of box. Nicest knife I own despite being one of the cheapest. Just wish it held an edge a little better but I expected that much from 8Cr13MoV. Also wish it was deep carry but that's just personal preference. I don't mind the top being exposed but I would rather have it deep carry. I held off on getting a spiderco for so long because I thought they looked weird but I got one and now all I see is beauty. The blade is nicely centered, the action is smooth and well balanced. Look no further. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but disappointing issue on deploying
customer_reviews.text: While I like the overall layout and build of the knife, deploying it was difficult and unreliable. Very stiff as received, and since I'm not a knife technician I decided to return it. I can't tell for sure, but there was some wear on one scale side that looked like it had been possibly returned once before. Decided to move up to an American made Para 3 LW and will see how that is - hopefully much better.
customer_reviews.author: Duane C.

customer_reviews.title: Surprising value!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 6 of these as gifts for the groomsmen in my upcoming wedding. Currently my every day carry is a Spyderco Endura, which is absolutely fantastic - however these came in at half the price and are extremely well built. I like the grip and light weight of the Endura handle, but the belt clip has had several issues. After lots of us and several hunting/fishing trips the belt clip needed to be replaced. The Tenacious clips and grips seem to be much more rigid. I think this is a great every day carry at an affordable price. After the wedding when I'm not broke, I'll probably pick up another 1 of these for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Bill BTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: This is a great knife. This is my first spyderco and being ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife. This is my first spyderco and being an imported piece was not sure what to expect. Well it's built very well and came from factory very sharp. I usually tend to purchase assisted opening knives but this one with the large hole seems to flip pretty easily. Definitely recommend buying if you are thinking about it. This will definitely not be my only spyderco.
customer_reviews.author: Jbritt

customer_reviews.title: Second One, very happy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Tenacious. Got the clip of the first one stuck on the back of a couple chairs when sitting down and that bent the clip enough that it was loose. Before I had a chance to remove and reshape it, I lost it on an out of town golf trip. Always sharp, opens and closes good. Very handy edc.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Man I love this knife. Im not a connoisseur but the steel quality has served me and the knife holds a edge pretty darn well. The blacked out low profile look is what I was going for and it does this flawlessly. Very easy to conceal and draw. For a lefty like myself, the clip is reversible and works well either way. Would have liked to have bought an American made Spyderco but for the price, this is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeALPHA

customer_reviews.title: New edition to the EDC
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a new knife for a while and a lot of people carry Spyderco knives so I decided to check this one out and I really love it. The handle on the knife has a really nice texture and grip to it just feels really good. It's bigger than I thought it was gonna be. From what I've been looking at you can customize the knife and put a different clip and scales on the knife so that's gonna be great later on when I decide to do that.
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Good knife.  Needs work!
customer_reviews.text: Good knife! Horrible clip. Failed in just over a month. Tightening didn’t help. Not a warranty part. Cost $8 to replace via Spyderco customer service. So...15% of product cost for a clip that was meant to fail. Glad I didn’t purchase the versions over $150
customer_reviews.author: Mark Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Make sure you avoid this knife. I mistakenly bought it thinking I’d found a deal, as most of my other spyderco knives are fantastic. That being said, the good ones are a bit pricier, and you’ll see they are made (blades) in Golden Colorado... not China. The Golden blades are fantastic. Hold their edge, tough, hard to beat. The “China” blade is far less when it comes to blade quality, strength, and how well they hold an edge. Spend a little more... get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: High quality and budget friendly EDC
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of knifes. Haven't left my house without one in years. This is my first sypderco, and this is an excellent knife. Knife came extremely sharp. Takes an edge and holds as well. Past year, my Benchmade 535 has been my EDC. I bought this because I wanted to add a Sypderco to my collection. Since I've picked this up, I found myself grabbing this more than I ever thought I would. I couldn't recommend this more for a great quality, budget friendly EDC knife.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Spyderco.
customer_reviews.text: The Spyderco Tenacious is a fantastic bargain of a knife. The blade is hair popping sharp and the liner lock locks up without any play. The blade is a bit stiff to deploy at first but has smoothed out nicely with use. The blades finish has proven to be quite durable and edge holding has been quite well too. There is no wiggle or play when the blade is locked open. While yes this knife is made in China, it is made to Spydercos high expectations. Do not let the Made in China fool you. It is still a top quality cutting tool.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Best knife ever owned,
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife and it is amazing. It never fails on me and is great and compact for the price. One thing though is be very careful when using this knife because out of the box it comes very sharp. I have cut myself pretty deep with this knife because i was not careful enough. The knife on the other hand cuts through many materials without a problem and is nice and small so it wont be a bother to be carrying around.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: A real tool.  Sharp, comfortable to use, and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.text: This is a rather odd looking knife. Very well made, sharp blade of good quality, it opens easily and locks securely, and has a beefy enough design to handle tough tasks. The attached clip holds the knife securely where you put it. I keep mine clipped under some webbing on a tactical style "man bag" I carry every day and no one has ever noticed it on the outside of the bad in plain sight where I can get to it easily. This is not a flashy blade for a knife fight but rather a real tool.
customer_reviews.author: Cheff Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great blade for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great great knife for the money, great lockup, g10- handle, 8cr steel which let’s face it not the best steel but cmon what do you expect for this price point? They could’ve used a much cheaper steel though so all in all if you’re looking for a cheaper edc but quality knife that you wouldn’t mind getting misplaced, lost ,etc. than this is a great knife for you. If you’re looking to get a knife as like a beginner Spyderco before you get into the better quality steel this would be a great beginner blade! Hell its a great blade for anyone for the price! Take care
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Graham

customer_reviews.title: Very nice knife
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these as a groomsmen gift a few years back and it has held up very well. I carry it almost every day. Compared to my expensive benchmade, I like them both about the same. I ended up getting this as a gift for someone else, since it is known to me as a great knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first Spyderco but, probably not my last.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect, I usually don't buy all the hype but I have to say, I really like this knife. Right out of the box, very smooth movement. No need for lube or adjustments to get it there. Played with the knife for about an hour and it got even better. Blade was very sharp, not razor sharp but, very sharp and a few minutes on a strope made it shaving sharp. I can see this being my EDC for the near future, or at least until I buy my next Spyderco.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S.

customer_reviews.title: Soild budget spyderco
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. Gave it to a buddy. 8cr13mov is soft steel, but who cares at this price point. Wish it was deep carry Poor blade centering on mine Very very very very very sharp G10 gives good feel and weight Pretty stiff so takes some wearing in until you can flick it. Also, made in china, but you would never think. Dont like that though. Great entry knife for spyderco
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: A perfect pocket knife
customer_reviews.text: While it's sturdy and SHARP, it's thin and lightweight. Simply put this is an amazing pocket knife. Some things to note: The blade flicks out buttery smooth with near zero effort. The blade does NOT come out just by flicking the knife as if you were opening it but with out actually using the thumb hole. This is important to note because POLICE use this as a test, and if the blade comes out with a flick of the wrist (again, without using the thumb hole, just holding it in your hand and flicking it) they can confiscate the blade from you as it does not meet legal safety regulations. THIS KNIFE DOES MEET THESE REGULATIONS
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knie!
customer_reviews.text: For being the “cheap” or “budget” Spyderco, this thing ROCKS. No, the steel isn’t the best but for an EDC knife it is perfect. It came scary sharp out of the box, it carries well and is more than worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Lamb

customer_reviews.title: First Spyderco
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how the spider hole deployment would work but it's honestly as smooth and as fast opening as any knife I've ever owned with a little practice I'm able to deploy blade single hand ambidextrously the blade came razor sharp out of the box and is easy to maintain its hone the cr18mov steel is fine for edc the pocket clip is great and can be moved for your preference of carry all in all I love this knife I'd definitely buy again at this price point it's hard to beat as a edc slicer
customer_reviews.author: Dboatner

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not really near the quality of higher end spyderco knives but not nearly the price either. Just wasn't my jib so i sent it back. Felt clunky, and just a hulk of a knife with no "fizz" like the para series.
customer_reviews.author: ibeenworkinontherailroad

customer_reviews.title: Still my favorite knife to carry
customer_reviews.text: Older design. Underwhelming steel. But for me, it just works. It is easy to keep the blade sharp, it slices thru cardboard like butter, easy to get a good grip on & only a little big in the pocket. Along with its big brother, the Resilience, it is my favorite knife to carry. And unlike the Resilience, people don't scream if I pull it out and open it up!
customer_reviews.author: YGBSM

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review After a Few Years of Use
customer_reviews.text: My first review of this knife was 5 stars. The knife opened smoothly, had a terrific blade and maintained it's sharp edge. This has been my EDC for years. The problem was 1. It was made in China and 2. With all the tools I have including my small computer repair tools, I had no way to tighten the three special screws that hold the clip. Now, after a few years, even though the blade is as good as new and it still opens smoothly, I have lost all three screws, so it is useless as a pocket knife except to maybe carry loosely in my pocket which is not really an option.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on a mission trip and give away at the end. The fit and finish was great and I am ashamed to say that I left it at home when I went on my trip. I took another knife I found on sale instead. Unfortunately that knife was not made as well as the Spyderco Tenacious and I felt bad to give it away. I'm back home carrying the Tenacious as my edc even though I have knives that cost 10 times more. Mine came sharp, even grinds, and better than expected. Use mine every day and don't have to worry about hurting it since it is so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: james w.

customer_reviews.title: Why are you reading this? Just buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this knife while I had it, unfortunately I forgot it while working on a trailer in North Dakota. This was a tough, killer work knife. I'd buy another one in a heartbeat, but I wouldn't get the black blade, again. It looks sharp, but my work knives are exposed to lots of water, dirt, mud, sand, and grit, so the coating was wearing pretty quickly. It kept an edge for as long as I could expect it to, given the abuse I put it through. I loved the handle, too. The G-10 rocks. I just haven't gotten around to ordering another one, but I will.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid knife at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Knife was much larger than I anticipated but it was also much sturdier and sharper than I anticipated! With that said, it needed a break in period and was a little squeaky for the first month or so. Opens up smoothly now, and I find myself carrying it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: James Capozzi

customer_reviews.title: Spyderco, They make amazing products!
customer_reviews.text: This is my EDC knife. I never leave the house without it. I stepped up from a CRKT Pazoda II and when I originally got this one, I was concerned about the size of it compared to my CRKT. It did take a bit to get used to, but now I barely even notice it. I work in an office and wear Docker type pants 4 days a week to work(casual Friday I get to wear jeans), and Jeans the rest of the time. It fits great in my pockets. I carry it in my front right pocket and it slides in/out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Sharp.. I was skeptical purchasing this EDC knife since it had only cost 40 dollars compared to the benchmade brands and others out there. When it came in the mail, I put it through several tests and even cut myself on it accidently as well. Out of the box, the sharpness even beat some of my 80 - 120 dollar EDC knives. Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tango

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my boyfriend for his birthday. He lived it. Good quality. He had one he lost and I couldn’t remember what brand it was so asked around and many suggested spyderco. We like supporting local so I ordered this one because he is a fan of all black. Come to find out the one he lost was a spyderco so he was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: whitless7

customer_reviews.title: It is definitely a good knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely a good knife for the price. The tenacious I was sent was not the one pictured. I was under the impression I was ordering a steel finished blade, but ended up with one that is painted black. I hate sharpening painted blades but the hassle of mailing it back is not worth it. I guess I will just hold on to this knife for a while. Nothing wrong with the product itself just not what I thought I was buying.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad knife for the price point. It came with a machine sharpened edge, sharp, but sloppy, It took me a little time to clean it up with a stone and strop. The build quality seems good. It is manufactured in China. I've read other reviews claiming knock off knives, I'm not keen enough to tell the difference, it does not seem to have any quality issues, no play in the blade when locked, the clip is sturdy, and so far it holds an edge good.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday knife well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The blade edge is a little flimsy. Its made well.. It comes out of your pocket and opens very easily and quickly. It's a great everyday knife, you don't have to worry about damaging it or loosing it because of the price. It' says made in china on it so they are not trying to pull a fast one.. I would have given 5 starts if the blade edge was a little more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: She’s sharp and takes a decent edge with a lansky
customer_reviews.text: She came pretty sharp out of the box but she needed a little dressing. Apparently I did it to well. Like a idiot I had my finger in the wrong place.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found this knife sooner
customer_reviews.text: Top notch quality for a basic pocket knife. I’ve used it just about everyday for months now. I want to buy another one but I just don’t need to.
customer_reviews.author: M.C. 24

customer_reviews.title: My new EDC.
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife. Zero complaints. I could go on and on about how sturdy, sharp (out of the box) and how smoothly it operates, but as a knife afficionado, I must say that this is one of the best I've ever owned. I've started choosing this over my old Benchmade Griptillian.
customer_reviews.author: tb

customer_reviews.title: Great budget EDC knife
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the money, larger than I expected (not a bad thing!), but you get what you pay for. Made in China (laser-etched on the blade), pretty solid, however the bronze (or copper?) washers that act as the bearing surface when opening the blade were pretty mangled. They are thin, but even after oiling, not very smooth and actually squeaks. Will have to take it apart and rebuild them. But these complaints are very minor, I am still carrying it every day! I love the plain "wedge" ground profile, very thick and robust. Also having 4 optional positions for the clip is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: j. trost

customer_reviews.title: My First Spyderco
customer_reviews.text: This is my first spyderco knife. It is of great quality. The blade is really sturdy and had a shaving edge right out of the box. The liner locking mechanism works as most liner locks do. The G-10 handle is wonderful providing a great grip and isn't heavy or bulky. The overall size of this knife is what led me to purchase it. This is my every day carry knife that will meet any daily challenge that I can throw at it. I would definitely recommend this knife to anyone searching for an inexpensive folding knife that is of great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday carry.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Spyderco knife and I love it. The handle is nice and grippy and the thumb hole works even in gloves. The steel holds a nice edge without much maintenance. I use this knife for everything from opening mail to cutting rope and shaving wood for starting fires. Very dependable and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley A Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and great build!
customer_reviews.text: My coworkers all have the $200 version of this knife. But straight out of the box, I love this one. It's very sharp, like very sharp. It definitely holds it's edge. I mainly have it as my EDC knife, it feels great in my hands and opens my amazon boxes just fine ^__^ I actually like the feel of this more then the expense versions. Only difference is the flip tab and the expensive version has a shorter blade.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L.

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC that keeps its edge
customer_reviews.text: Caught it on sale and bought a few as christmas presents for a few friends. No play at all in the blade and it has kept its edge. The steel is not of the highest quality, wouldn't recommend prying anything open with it but the action is smooth and the lock is solid. I have a ton of knives all ranging in quality and this one somehow always finds its way back in mine and my buddies EDC.
customer_reviews.author: Captainflapjax

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Spyderco knife, nearly all my knives are Gerber & Kershaw and I had trepidations on buying something different but I had heard and seen good things in reviews and this knife does not disappoint. Comes from the factory razor sharp, handle has a great feel with the G-10 handle has micro scales and feels like it won't slip even when wet, also has this heft to it that makes me feel like I'm going to be using this knife 5 years from now. Came a little stiff but a shot of WD-40 took care of that quick. Overall great price great knife.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC Knife
customer_reviews.text: Great knife arrived sharp and holds an edge well. Spyderco quality throughout. Buy it you won't regret it. Lots of feature usually reserved for more expensive knives. The pocket clip can be moved to any of the four corners which is great for lefties like myself. The handles are grippy enough but could use a little deeper stippling as it might get a little slick if wet. All in all I would definitely buy again if the need arose.
customer_reviews.author: D. Myers

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Spyderco
customer_reviews.text: Just received my knife a couple of days ago. So far so good. The weight, the blade and the feel of knife is great. This is my first Spyderco pocket knife from China. I am assuming this is a lower end due to the cost of the knife. I'll have another review once I get to use it more
customer_reviews.author: Bob Riberal

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: This was the only thing on my young adult grandsons Christmas list. He lost his other one and like it so much, he wanted another one.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: I carry this everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: I carry this as a part of my edc and its the perfect size. Its not the most expensive knives out there but its great quality and holds up well. Ii use it for just about anything. I have had several knives and more expensive knives but this one is the one i feel most comfortable carrying everyday,
customer_reviews.author: Jason H Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife to replace a similar looking Benchmade tanto that someone misplaced. I try to buy American whenever I can, but I just needed an inexpensive replacement while I look for my other knife. I'm not sure what I really expected when I ordered this knife, but I am seriously impressed so far. This is the sharpest knife I've ever used. The action is smooth, the handle is reasonably comfortable and you can move the clip to several positions. It feels very solid in your hand. I would without a doubt consider more Spyderco knives in the future.
customer_reviews.author: M. Picotte

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner knife for an expensive hobby
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the price. Made in China, but it's still under Spyderco's brand on it so it's well-made. I've used it daily for a few months and the handle hasn't come loose and the blade is still sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mid-range knife, far superior to the Byrd line.
customer_reviews.text: I had a CaraCara2 (Byrd, Spyderco's budget line) and this is its replacement. Superior build quality, ergos, materials and a sharp blade out of the box... what's not to like? Plus the price is great compared with the typical Spyderco price floor of around $100. Overall a great mid-range knife.
customer_reviews.author: R.Chase

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, great knife for a kid to grow with.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent blade great quality build. I have had a Spyderco Police model for over 25 years, and my hope is that my son will care for this knife and have it as an adult as well. He is in scouts, and needed a lock blade for use to earn his whittling chip. This has been great for him to use, and when his hands are larger, he will be able to operate it with one hand when needed. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice S.

customer_reviews.title: That’s as good as it gets in the >$50 ballpark
customer_reviews.text: This Chinese Spyderco has a cheap steel blade with actual G10 scales for >$50. Of all things, mine has crisp, clear lock-up, no horizontal or vertical blade play and the blade is perfectly centered. That’s as good as it gets in the >$50 ballpark.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: but the flip action is still great to use
customer_reviews.text: For $40 you get a lot of knife for the money! After opening the knife I was surprised to see how big it was compared to my Spyderco Sage! The blade steel is cheaper, but the flip action is still great to use! It will eventually ruin my pants pockets and the black will likely scratch off however I have had worse knifes for $40 and less and for the money you are getting a true classic.
customer_reviews.author: HypnoVike

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be decent quality however it's a little stiff ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be decent quality however it's a little stiff to deploy, I tried loosening the pivot screw a bit and oiled it some but it appears the tension is too strong on the blade from the liner lock and the detent ball. You can still open it one handed but it's fairly hard to "flick" open with one finger.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Kocak

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Kershaws in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely one of the better pocketknives that I have. It's super cool because I can open it just as fast as a spring assisted knife, if not faster. You just stick your thumbnail in the hole vertically rather than resting your thumb on top of the hole, and you just flick. It's got a super smooth mechanism and is overall a fantastic pocketknife.
customer_reviews.author: Alex RayTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Love this knife, worth every penny, excellent EDC
customer_reviews.text: love love love this knife. replaced another similar sized knife with this and haven't looked back. Not that my other knife was bad, but this one is awesome, worth every penny. Its a great quality of steel for balancing edge retention with sharpness and longevity, its got excellent build quality, and the blade style is easy to maintain and gives it tons of belly to cut with. The G-10 grips are great in all kinds of situations and it fits great in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for skinning.
customer_reviews.text: The handle fits nicely in the hand for skinning, as it would for about any activity. Very nice catch, very safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: bowhunter

customer_reviews.title: worth the money, spyderco on a budget
customer_reviews.text: awesome knife for the money. a little on the heavy side but slices like a dream. recently purchased the ontario rat 2 as well but they are all good, can't go wrong with either one. my only advice would be to go with a standard polish blade because after awhile of use the black coating will wear off. nothing last's forever but quality stands out when you need it the most.
customer_reviews.author: dez nuts

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've lived by SOG for years but this knife even after less than a day is swaying my mind. This is hands down the sharpest knife out of box I have ever had and the action is butter smooth. Perfect size for an EDC, good weight, nice blade contour, and a thumb hole is so much more than a thumb stud. Hands down my favorite knife in my collection to date and I've only had it for a day, that has to say something
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: This is my first and definitely not last Spyderco.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is dangerously sharp right out of the box. I started taking blood thinning meds a day before this knife came in, and I almost had to keep it in my desk instead of using it in my EDC. If I still lived with my mom, I know she would take this knife from me. I knicked my thumb learning to close it and it bled for almost an hour. I was slightly disappointed that the Cabelas here had this knife priced just a dollar and change more than what I paid on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: LBKewee

customer_reviews.title: Great knife :))
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had D2 or something better, but for the price it's Awesome. I might get addicted to spiderco knifes now :)) can't wait to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: john west

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knife, I was a bit concerned it would be too large for EDC but it's now my favorite when I'm not restricted on space, very smooth even after the daily dirt/grit I've exposed it to the last few months, liked it so much I bought a second (if they drop below $40 again I'll get more)
customer_reviews.author: Ben C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool. It feels real good to hold and useful at my job but after awhile it’s hard to sharpen since it gets thicker to the top
customer_reviews.author: luis Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Best daily use pocket knife I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the price. Made me a believer in the brand. Had it over a year and wear it daily. Sharpens easily, holds edge good. Blade coating has held up great despite certain abuse like opening beer bottles on the spine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug B.

customer_reviews.title: and unlike my much loved Delica 4
customer_reviews.text: The fit and finish on this knife is, well, astounding. It is one of the smoothest opening folders I own. Furthermore, and unlike my much loved Delica 4, the Tenacious' spydie hole was well polished with no sharp edges or machining marks. The edge grind was well done and came sharp. This is easily one of the best folders I have. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Looks good feels good and holding its blade, always been a fan of spyderco i was worried about buying a low end one but so far it's been a great knife
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Because for $40 you get one of the sharpest knives out of the box and a great quality product with mid range 8cr13MoV steel
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should own one of these knives. Why? Because for $40 you get one of the sharpest knives out of the box and a great quality product with mid range 8cr13MoV steel. These blades are also very easy to sharpen. I can't believe the value. Some guys spend more on Mall Ninja-looking knives that are just pathetic in terms of quality. For less than $50, you're getting a fantastic tool that you can carry everyday. And at that price, you're not going to be devastated if you lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler n megan

customer_reviews.title: TOP NOTCH! Great Spydie
customer_reviews.text: Go ahead, watch all the reviews and read everything you can on the Tenacious. There isn't anything bad about this knife for a reason-it holds an edge well, the G10 handle is ergonomic even for reverse grip, the clip holds strong. Middle finger flick deployment is as fast if not faster than multiple assisted folders I've had. There is only one thing this knife is lacking, which is a deep carry pocket clip-which is personal preference. You can order these on Amazon as well :) INCREDIBLE folder, easily comparable to a budget SOG or Benchmade.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Lykins

customer_reviews.title: Do not use this knife to cut tape and open packages
customer_reviews.text: This knife works well enough. However, when cutting through tape such as when opening packages, a sticky residue from the normal clear tape will get stuck on the knife. It is very difficult to get off, and the residue will be all over your knife as you keep using it. I'm not sure if it's the black coating that is responsible. Anyway, I had to return mine. This never happens with my Kershaw knife.
customer_reviews.author: Philo

customer_reviews.title: Can't find a better knife for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best knives for the money. I know they are made in china but these things are solid and really hold an edge. This is my second one. I lost the first one and could not find the quality in others for the same price. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Reid

customer_reviews.title: Chinese junk
customer_reviews.text: I either got a counterfeit or this knife is just not nice. Heavy, with a slow almost grinding action. Love my spidercos and even Byrd’s as beaters but gonna stay away from the Chinese spiders now.
customer_reviews.author: Joooohhhhnmnnnnnyyyy

customer_reviews.title: Very, very, very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is razor sharp right out of the box. I have been carrying it everyday for the past couple months and so far I have been very satisfied with its quality and ability to retain its edge. Overall it is not a heavy knife and the handle is some sort of composite material Blade feels sturdy when it's locked open and feels overall like a high quality knife. Wish it was made in USA, but i'm sure that is why it is so cheap compared to other Spyderco's
customer_reviews.author: HGM

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable? Time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: I like my Spyderco Tenacious and use it for occasional EDC. It is a fairly large knife best used on large projects. It can be a real pocketful. "Is that a Spyderco in your pocket or are you glad to se me?" It came shave sharp and ready for use. The only downer is that it is not American made.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC blade
customer_reviews.text: Amazing EDC knife. I needed a knife to replace my Kershaw cryo that I had lost. I decided to spend a little bit more as I used the cryo a ton. This is my first Spyderco knife and I must say I am an instant fan. The fit and finish is amazing quality and the blade is sharp right out of the box. I Would definitely recommend this as an EDC blade
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Balance is good and is actually good for throwing
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality SpyderCo puts into there more expensive models. It's a knife is what I think when I look at it. Balance is good and is actually good for throwing. The Tenacious model doesn't hold an edge very well but serves its purpose as a pocket knife. It's comforting to know that I didn't spend much money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob304

customer_reviews.title: Not a fake! 5 star knife!
customer_reviews.text: Great knife at a great value. Feels solid with smooth action and its sharp AF! For those of you reading the 1 star reviews, ignore the "fake" "China" reviews. If you research Spyderco's website, you'll see that all of their knives are made in either China, Taiwan or Japan.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp knife, best EDC knife out there
customer_reviews.text: Best EDC knife ever. It is cheap enough just to carry around and not worry about scratches or surface damage. It comes out of the box SHARP, sharp enough to shave your arm!! The lock up is amazing and very positive. The blade holds an edge very well. The only thing some might see as a problem is that is is made in china
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sir

customer_reviews.title: Rugged. Sharp. Smooth.
customer_reviews.text: This knife will prove to be the most blade for your buck. It opens flawlessly, locks solidly, cuts like a razor, and looks good! I won't deny that I'm biased for Spyderco as I have purchased various enduras, delicas, even the police 3. I also have many kershaws, sogs, cold steels but spyderco is overall my favorite brand. This model in particular is my top pick in the category for value.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Colister

customer_reviews.title: Great First Spyderco!
customer_reviews.text: Great EDC. What a tremendous value. Holds its edge and performs so well. Easily opens and closes with one hand. Spyderco is a great brand and this is an inexpensive way to put one in your pocket. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bissett

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife sharp out of the box good size and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Knife sharp out of the box good size and weight for an EDC. Bought this to replace a Kabar bk-11 I lost for an EDC. Was a little hesitant to go back to a folder, but this nice is smaller and more comfortable to carry the spider hole also makes it easy to open quickly. Also the jimping on the blade and the G10 handle makes for a great feel in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: This handle feels very comfortable and natural in my hand
customer_reviews.text: My typical weekend carry knife for when you don't expect to be doing any hard work, but if you do, the knife can handle it. I recently broke down 8 large cardboard boxes into small disposable squares. The edge caught on paper and started to tear it, but just a few passes on the strop with green compound brought the edge right back. This handle feels very comfortable and natural in my hand. I could never choose my favorite one and only folder, but if I had to choose 5, this would be one of the 5.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gaulden

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great! Hard to describe how great this knife is
customer_reviews.text: Simply Great! Hard to describe how great this knife is. You have to hold it in your hand and you'll see! Excellent quality, and It just fits in my hand perfectly. Crazy sharp out of the box! You really can not wrong buying this knife.
customer_reviews.author: EY

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a pocket knife with you. This one fits nicely in your pocket or glove box.
customer_reviews.author: ShuberLife

customer_reviews.title: excellent spyderco
customer_reviews.text: I am no stranger to when it comes to owning a spyderco. I always heard if you're a true collector you need a tenacious. After looking around I found the black variation. To be honest since its a lower end spyderco its not bad. Definitely worth adding to ones collection. I intend to buy a paramilitary 2 when I come into funds. Over all the black tenacious is a solid blade. No side to side play. The lock up is excellent for a liner lock. If you're on the fence get it. You cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando L.

customer_reviews.title: ... a reasonably priced knife that takes and holds a good edge. It is durable enough for most tasks
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably priced knife that takes and holds a good edge. It is durable enough for most tasks, and surprisingly comfortable given its bare-bones design. Get a dual-rod ceramic sharpener to bring out the best edge
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good size blade. Fits well in hand. Definitely like the look.
customer_reviews.author: bvbab

customer_reviews.title: Not Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had this knife for about 2 weeks now and I'm very happy! The blade is actually a little darker than the model on Amazon, but it is still very nice. The lock system is on the frame and this model is actually made in china. That's the only reason I gave this knife 4 stars. There are much better locking systems than the one you're given however, it is still very well built. I use for EDC and I'm getting much more knives from Spyderco in the future! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a Spyderco
customer_reviews.text: Shaves right out of the box, plus the all black is a nice touch. I own 7 of these in varying size and serrated or not, and carry daily depending on the situation. They're made in China but honestly for $40 if I lose or break, Amazon prime sends me a new one two days later. Couldn't be happier. As always.
customer_reviews.author: ilikedeermeat

customer_reviews.title: Another super spyderco
customer_reviews.text: Great Knife for the cost. Razor sharp out of the box. Holds a decent edge. I think Spyderco does a good job with the heat treat on the 8Cr13MoV. I'm liking the spidey hole. It's very quick to deploy. The full flat grind makes it a superb slicer. It is pretty comfortable in the hand, and build quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton Carr

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my brother for Christmas he use it everyday in landscape it’s a good knife
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Dont use it much but it is good. Nice little pocket knife
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Squeaking
customer_reviews.text: Quality metal and parts, but there is a little squeaking noise when the blade opens and closes. It isn’t even loud but it bothers me that it’s there. I’ll update the review once I’ve gotten this solved, and maybe I can help someone else.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Locks up well, sturdy, came sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the price. A little tough opening compared to the notorious PM2 But that’s to be expected for less than half the price
customer_reviews.author: wendy newcomb

customer_reviews.title: A tenascious knife
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of my favorite knives I have owned, especially in the budget category! I have carried mine everyday for close to 2 years and have no failures of any kind. The blade retains a pretty good edge, and can be readily sharpened when needed. The G10 handle scales work well, and are flat keeping the knife slim in your pocket. I also really appreciated the four spots spyderco built in for the clip placement, allowing tip up or down carry on both sides of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: The Hawk

customer_reviews.title: great knife
customer_reviews.text: nothing to complain about it. would recommend to anyone looking for a everyday pocket knife
customer_reviews.author: stephane

customer_reviews.title: very good EDC
customer_reviews.text: I have a PM-2 and this is a lot like it at 1/3 the price. for EDC if it gets lost I will not cry anywhere near as long.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about 3 months now and it feels exactly like how i get it day one. Super sharp still
customer_reviews.author: emulicious

customer_reviews.title: Hurry up and buy one already.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite EDC. I love the blade geometry and I love the fact it didn't cost an arm and a leg (I'm not afraid to actually use it). I know it's made in china but it's a great little knife. I literally use this knife daily. It's always the knife I find myself going to in the morning when I'm getting ready, even though I own other, more expensive knives.
customer_reviews.author: F1oored

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking knife
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife! Great looks and superb functionality! Only complaint is that after dropping it onto the concrete garage surface, the black coating came off rather easy... so I have a silver-looking ding on my knife. No biggy! Just expected the black finnish to be a little more durable.
customer_reviews.author: NA_in_Carmichael_CA

customer_reviews.title: Probably fake
customer_reviews.text: Received an oponed item with paperwork for a different knife. Came with missing screws. Bushings were made of plastic. No item numbers or model number on the box
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife, not a hard use blade steel.
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife, the blade steel leaves alot to be desired, could be the heat treat. Chippy and doesnt handle abrasive/adhesive wear well if used on the job but its stainless so you kind of expect that. Fit and finish are good, build quality is good, fine knife for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: chowder

product_meta.title: Spyderco Tenacious Value Folding Knife with 3.39" Black Stainless Steel Blade and Durable G-10 Handle - PlainEdge - C122GBBKP
feature_bullets: GAME CHANGER - Being tenacious means you are persistent and cohesive. It's being tough and tireless in achieving your best performance; all worthy descriptive words for a hard-use knife
SUPERIOR BLADE STEEL - The 3.39" 8Cr13MoV stainless blade is coated in a non-reflective black coating and ground-flat from spine to cutting-edge for non-stop cutting.
A SECURE GRIP - It has a black G-10 laminate handle, ergonomically milled with prolonged fatigue-free cutting in mind.

EASY-TO-USE - The blade’s shape coupled with an oversized Spyderco Round Hole and textured spine jimping allows you to open the blade and position your thumb on the spine in slip-proof confidence ready for work
POCKET-FRIENDLY - The Tenacious includes a Walker LinerLock and a 4-way pocket clip lets the folder be set in a variety of carry and draw positions: Tip-up/tip-down left-hand/right-hand.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,304 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
